w:r.w:t: 2.1 Technology Stack: Open SaaS + Wasp Framework
Appendix A: Gap Resolution Summary (from v2.0)
Appendix B: Wasp/Open SaaS Technical Reference

Builders Stream Pro is a comprehensive, modular, web-based software platform purpose-built for construction and renovation contractors. It unifies every aspect of the contractor workflow — from initial lead capture and estimating through project execution, financial management, and client delivery — into a single, intuitive system that eliminates the need for multiple disconnected software tools.

The platform is designed to serve the full spectrum of construction professionals: residential remodelers, custom home builders, commercial general contractors, specialty trade contractors, roofing and exterior specialists, and large-scale enterprise construction firms. Each contractor type receives a tailored experience through the platform's modular architecture, ensuring they only encounter features relevant to their specific workflow.

The construction software market remains highly fragmented, with contractors typically juggling between 4–12 different software tools for project management, accounting, estimating, scheduling, and client communication. This fragmentation creates data silos, manual double-entry, communication breakdowns, and significant productivity losses estimated at 15–25% of project overhead.

Builders Stream Pro addresses this gap by delivering an all-in-one platform with the depth of specialized tools and the integration of a unified system. By consolidating these workflows, contractors can expect measurable improvements in project delivery timelines, budget accuracy, client satisfaction scores, and overall profitability.
Every feature must pass the 'field test' — can a superintendent use it on a muddy job site with gloves on? If not, redesign it.
Contractors pay for and see only the modules they need. A residential remodeler should never encounter enterprise RFI management unless they want it.
The mobile experience is not a stripped-down version of the desktop. It is designed independently with field-specific workflows, offline capability, and one-thumb operation.
QuickBooks, Xero, supplier catalogs, and building codes integrate natively. The platform serves as the hub, not a walled garden.
A new contractor should be managing their first project within 60 minutes of signup, with guided onboarding and smart templates.
2.1 Technology Stack: Open SaaS + Wasp Framework

Builders Stream Pro v3.0 is built on Open SaaS, a production-ready SaaS boilerplate powered by the Wasp full-stack framework. This strategic technology decision provides significant advantages for rapid development, maintainability, AI-assisted coding, and deployment flexibility.
Wasp is a Rails-like full-stack framework for React, Node.js, and Prisma. It uses a declarative Domain Specific Language (DSL) in

to define app structure, authentication, database models, server actions, background jobs, and routing — all in one place. The Wasp compiler generates boilerplate code, letting developers focus on construction-specific business logic.
config file defines routes, auth, queries, actions, jobs, and entities. Single source of truth for app architecture.
React 18 with Vite bundler for fast development.
components for responsive UI. Progressive Web App (PWA) capability with service workers for offline field use.
Node.js/Express server auto-generated by Wasp. Server-side actions and queries with full TypeScript support. WebSocket support for real-time collaborative features.
PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM for type-safe database queries. Auto-generated client with full TypeScript types. TimescaleDB extension available for time-series financial data.
Wasp Auth with email/password, Google OAuth, GitHub OAuth. Email verification, password reset, and session management
Stripe integration for subscriptions and one-time payments. Lemon Squeezy as alternative payment provider. Webhook handling and Customer Portal included.
-boss for PostgreSQL-backed job queues. Cron scheduling defined declaratively in
. Retries, delays, and job status tracking
AWS S3 integration for document and photo uploads. Pre-signed URLs for secure client-side uploads. CDN distribution for fast document access.
, or SMTP integration. Templated emails with React Email components for professional contractor communications.
Plausible or Google Analytics integration. Admin dashboard with real-time stats aggregated via background jobs.
Open SaaS provides a production-ready foundation with features that would otherwise take months to build from scratch:
TypeScript types flow automatically from database models through server actions to React components, eliminating runtime type errors and improving code quality.
Authentication, subscription billing, admin dashboard, email sending, file uploads, and analytics come pre-configured and tested.
configuration file serves as a single source of truth, making the codebase exceptionally well-suited for AI-assisted development (vibe coding).
One-command deployment to Fly.io, Railway, or Netlify. Docker support for self-hosted or enterprise deployments with no vendor lock-in.
100% free and open-source stack reduces licensing costs and provides full control over the codebase. No per-seat licensing fees for the framework itself.
Wasp's Discord community and Open SaaS documentation provide support and best practices for construction-specific customizations.

file serves as the central nervous system of Builders Stream Pro, declaring all core app features in a single, readable configuration. This structure makes the codebase clear for developers and AI coding assistants.
{ wasp: { version: '^0.16.0' }, title: 'Builders Stream Pro', auth: { ... },
Prisma schema models for Project, Client, Estimate, Invoice, User, Organization,

The platform is organized into twelve core modules (expanded from ten in v1.0 to address gap analysis findings). Modules share a common data layer and event bus but maintain independent business logic, enabling contractors to activate only the modules relevant to their operation. New modules added in v2.0: Payroll & Workforce Management, Service & Warranty Management.
Centralized dashboard, project lifecycle management, all-in-one status tracking
Lead capture, pipeline tracking, client communication, marketing automation, reputation management
Digital takeoffs, cost database, assembly builder, proposal generation, Excel/CSV export, aerial measurement
Gantt charts, resource allocation, crew dispatch, equipment tracking, depreciation
Job costing, construction accounting, invoicing, budgets, QuickBooks/Xero sync, client financing
Client-facing portal for approvals, selections, 3D visualization, communication, payments, financing
Version-controlled docs, photo management, RFI tracking, submittal logs
Daily logs, time tracking, GPS crew tracking, mobile time clock, safety checklists
Inspection checklists, safety incident tracking, OSHA compliance, audit trails
Payroll processing, certified payroll, W-2/1099, prevailing wage, union payroll, benefits admin
Service tickets, warranty tracking, maintenance dispatch, recurring service agreements
Custom dashboards, financial reports, project analytics, KPI tracking, payroll & service reports

Each contractor organization operates in a fully isolated tenant with separate data partitions, user pools, and configuration. The multi-tenancy model uses PostgreSQL Row-Level Security (RLS) combined with Prisma middleware to ensure complete data isolation between contractor accounts.
Central Organization model with relationships to all tenant-specific data. Users belong to one or more organizations with role assignments per org.
Automatic tenant filtering on all queries.
is injected into WHERE clauses transparently. Prevents cross-tenant data access.
PostgreSQL RLS policies as defense-in-depth. Even direct SQL access respects tenant boundaries.
React context provides current organization throughout the app. Server actions receive tenant context automatically via Wasp's auth system.
Each organization has independent Stripe subscription. Module activations and user limits enforced per-tenant.

The Project Command Center serves as the central nervous system of Builders Stream Pro. Upon login, contractors see a unified dashboard that aggregates real-time data from all active modules, presenting a complete operational picture at a glance. The dashboard is fully customizable with drag-and-drop widgets, saved layouts per user role, and intelligent alerts that surface only the most actionable items.

Visual cards for each active project showing completion percentage (animated progress ring), budget burn rate vs. timeline position, next milestone date, and a traffic light indicator (green/yellow/red) based on algorithmic health scoring.

Real-time P&L view across all projects showing total revenue, committed costs, actual costs, gross margin by project, and cash flow forecast for the next 30/60/90 days. Click any metric to drill into project-level detail.
Compressed Gantt view showing all active project timelines overlaid, with crew allocation heat map identifying overcommitted resources and idle capacity. Critical path items highlighted in red.

AI-prioritized list of items requiring attention: overdue tasks, pending approvals, unanswered client messages, expiring subcontractor bids, weather alerts for outdoor projects, and approaching deadlines.
Real-time feed of crew check-ins, daily log submissions, photo uploads, completed inspections, and change order approvals. Filterable by project, team member, or activity type.
5-day forecast for each active job site with automatic alerts when conditions may impact scheduled outdoor work. Historical weather data linked to daily logs for documentation.

Every project in Builders Stream Pro follows a configurable lifecycle from initial lead through warranty closeout. The system enforces stage-gate controls that prevent progression without required approvals, ensuring documentation completeness and regulatory compliance.
Initial contact captured, site visit scheduled, preliminary scope documented. Automated follow-up sequences engaged.
Detailed scope definition, digital takeoff initiated, cost assemblies applied, preliminary budget range established with confidence intervals.
Professional proposal generated with itemized or lump-sum options, design renderings attached, client-facing selection sheets linked. E-signature enabled.
Signed proposal converts to contract with payment schedule, change order policies, and warranty terms. Deposit invoice
Project scheduling begins, purchase orders issued, permits tracked, crew assignments made. Client portal activated.
Final walkthrough scheduled, punch list items logged with photos, completion certificates prepared.
Final payment collected, warranty period initiated, project archived with full documentation package for future reference.
from multiple sources and tracks them through a construction-specific sales pipeline with automated follow-ups and conversion analytics.
Web forms, phone calls (with call tracking), email parsing, home show scanning, referral tracking, and third-party lead services (HomeAdvisor, Angi, Houzz) all flow into a unified inbox.
Automatic scoring based on project size, timeline urgency, budget indicators, source quality, and engagement level.
leads surface to the top with priority notifications.
Configurable pipeline stages: New Lead → Contacted → Site Visit Scheduled → Site Visit Complete → Estimate Sent → Negotiating → Won/Lost. Drag-and-drop movement with required notes.
Scheduled email/SMS sequences for each stage. Reminder notifications for salespeople when leads go cold. Templates for common responses.
Track reasons for lost deals, competitor mentions, pricing feedback. Dashboard showing conversion rates by source, salesperson, and project type.
All interactions with a client (emails, calls, texts, site visits, invoices) logged in one timeline. Search across all contacts and communication history.
companies with parent/child relationships. Track multiple contacts per company with roles (Decision Maker, Influencer, Accounts Payable).
Track internal team licenses and certifications with renewal reminders and compliance dashboards. (NEW in v2.0)
Unlimited custom fields for contractor-specific data: property type, HOA requirements, financing pre-approval status, design preferences.
Tag contacts for marketing campaigns, project types, geographic areas. Create smart lists that update automatically.
The automation engine uses Wasp's background jobs system to execute workflows based on triggers and conditions, reducing manual administrative work.
When a lead is marked 'Site Visit Complete,' automatically create estimate shell, send thank-you email, and schedule follow-up task for salesperson.
If estimate not signed within 7 days, send reminder email. If
response within 14 days, trigger call task. After 30 days, move to 'Stalled' with re-engagement campaign.
Route leads to appropriate salesperson based on project type, location, or lead source. High-value leads (>$100K) automatically assigned to senior estimators.
Design and send marketing emails with contractor-focused templates: seasonal promotions, maintenance reminders, referral requests, project showcases.
Monitor Google, Yelp, and Facebook reviews. Automated request for reviews after project completion. Response templates with sentiment analysis.
Track referral sources with commission calculations. Automated thank-you communications to referrers.
Client-approved project galleries for marketing use. Automatic watermarking and social media formatting.
The digital takeoff module allows estimators to measure directly from plans, photos, or satellite imagery, with automatic calculations and cost lookups.
Upload PDF, DWG, or image files. One-click scale calibration using known dimensions. Multi-page plan sets with automatic sheet naming.
Linear (walls, trim), area (flooring, painting), count (fixtures, outlets), volume (excavation, concrete). All measurements stored with plan annotations.
Integration with satellite imagery for roofing, siding, and landscape measurements. Automatic pitch detection for roofs. Historical imagery for property changes.
Pre-built takeoff templates for common project types. Extract measurements from one project type and apply to similar future projects.
Cross-check measurements against industry standards. Flag unusual quantities (e.g., 500 SF bathroom). Export measurements for external review.
The cost database combines contractor historical data, supplier pricing, and regional benchmarks to produce accurate estimates with confidence ranges.
Pre-built assemblies combine labor, materials, and equipment for common work items. 'Install kitchen cabinet' includes cabinet, hardware, labor, and cleanup.
Maintain material costs with supplier links, labor rates by trade and skill level, equipment rental rates. Regional cost adjustments based on location.
Compare estimates to actual costs from completed projects. System learns from variances to improve future accuracy. 'Your bathroom estimates typically run 8% over budget on tile labor.'
Each estimate includes low/expected/high ranges based on project complexity, contractor history, and market volatility.
Configurable markup rules by project type, client type, and margin targets. Visualize profitability impact of pricing decisions.
Professional proposal templates with customizable branding, terms, and layouts. Different templates for residential vs. commercial, remodel vs. new construction.
Present itemized breakdowns for transparency or lump-sum pricing for simplicity. Toggle visibility of individual line items.
Present upgrade options (premium fixtures, extended warranties) that clients can add with a click. Pre-calculate impact on total.
or built-in signing. Timestamp and IP logging for legal compliance.
Signed proposals automatically convert to active projects. Payment schedules, change order policies, and warranty terms
Export estimates to Excel for external sharing. CSV export for accounting import. PDF generation for offline review.
Interactive Gantt chart scheduling with drag-and-drop task management, dependency linking, and automatic critical path calculation.
Drag-and-drop task bars with zoom from daily to yearly views. Color coding by phase, trade, or status. Baseline comparison showing schedule drift.
Define finish-to-start, start-to-start, and lag relationships. System automatically shifts dependent tasks when predecessors change.
Automatic calculation of critical path with highlighting. 'What-if' analysis showing impact of delays on project completion.
Define key milestones (permit approval, rough-in inspection, client walkthrough) with automatic notifications and dashboard visibility.
Overlay multiple project timelines to identify resource conflicts and optimize crew utilization across jobs.
Assign crews to tasks with skill-based matching. View crew availability across all projects. Flag overallocation conflicts.
Track owned equipment location, availability, and maintenance schedules. Integration with rental companies for external equipment.
Maintain approved subcontractor list with insurance tracking, licensing verification, and performance ratings.
Forecast resource needs based on pipeline projects. Identify hiring needs or subcontractor requirements months in advance.
Track equipment depreciation schedules for accounting and replacement planning.
Track every dollar spent against estimates with real-time variance analysis and margin protection alerts.
Hierarchical cost codes matching estimate line items. Roll-up views by phase, trade, or custom categories.
Log expenses via mobile photo receipt, manual entry, credit card
, or vendor invoice. Automatic categorization by vendor.
at loaded labor rates. Overtime, burden, and benefit multipliers applied.
Track purchase orders and subcontracts as committed costs. See total exposure (actual + committed) vs. budget.
Configurable alerts when cost categories exceed budget thresholds. 'Lumber costs are 15% over budget with 60% of work complete.'
Construction-specific chart of accounts with job costing integration. Work-in-progress (WIP) accounting support.
Track vendor invoices, payment terms, and cash requirements. Automated payment scheduling with cash flow optimization.
Client invoice tracking, aging reports, and collection workflows. Automatic late payment reminders.
Import bank transactions, match to recorded expenses, flag discrepancies for review.
Generate P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow statements. Job-level P&L for project profitability analysis.
Create invoices from progress milestones, time entries, or custom amounts. AIA G702/G703 format for commercial projects.
Clients pay via credit card or ACH through the Client Portal. Stripe Connect integration for automated fund disbursement.
Define payment milestones tied to project phases. Automatic invoice generation at milestone completion.
Track retainage holdbacks and release schedules. Automatic release invoices at project closeout.
Integration with Hearth and GreenSky for client financing applications directly from invoices.
Bidirectional sync with QuickBooks Online and Desktop eliminates double-entry and ensures financial data consistency.
OAuth 2.0 connection via Wasp background jobs. Syncs customers, invoices, payments, bills, and chart of accounts. Runs every 4 hours.
Web Connector integration for contractors on desktop versions. Scheduled sync with conflict resolution.
Map Builders Stream Pro cost codes to QuickBooks classes and items. Automatic categorization on sync.
Payments received in Builders Stream Pro automatically recorded in QuickBooks. Client credit updates reflected.
Full API integration for international contractors. Multi-currency support with exchange rate handling.
Create change orders from field requests, client asks, or unforeseen conditions. Approval routing to project manager and client.
Automatic calculation of cost and schedule impact. 'This change adds $4,500 and extends completion by 3 days.'
Generate POs from estimate line items or manual entry. Track delivery status, partial receipts, and invoice matching.
Match PO, receiving document, and vendor invoice before payment approval. Flag discrepancies for review.
Vendors can view POs, submit invoices, and track payment status online.
Portal provides homeowners and commercial clients with transparent project visibility, selection management, and communication tools — all accessible via a white-labeled web interface.
Client sees real-time project status: current phase, next milestones, recent activity feed, and progress photos. No contractor
Organized photo galleries by date and project phase. Clients can
, comment, and download images for their records.
Interactive selection sheets for fixtures, finishes, and materials. Each selection shows pricing, lead times, and installation photos. Approval workflow with electronic signature.
Structured approval process for change orders, selections, design modifications, and draw requests. Automatic reminders for pending approvals.
View payment history, upcoming scheduled payments, and outstanding balances. Make payments via credit card, ACH, or digital check.
Simplified schedule view showing upcoming milestones and scheduled activities. Automatic notifications when work is scheduled.
Client-accessible documents: contracts, permits, warranty information, product manuals. Organized by category with search.
Interactive 3D floor plan viewer where clients can explore proposed layouts, view material renderings, and compare options.
Communication quality differentiates contractors. Builders Stream Pro makes excellent communication effortless through automation and templates.
Configurable automatic updates when milestones are reached, daily logs filed, or photos uploaded. Choose real-time, daily digest, or weekly summary frequency.
Pre-written templates for common scenarios: project kickoff, weekly update, milestone reached, schedule delay, change order presentation, payment reminder, completion.
Internal metrics tracking response time to client messages. Alerts when messages go unanswered beyond thresholds.
Automated satisfaction surveys at project milestones. Net Promoter Score tracking. Feedback routed to project manager.
Construction-grade document management with version control, access permissions, audit trails, and workflow routing. Handles everything from initial plans through warranty closeout.
Automatic versioning with full change history. Compare any two versions side-by-side. Previous versions accessible with clear current/superseded labeling.
route to architect, track response time, log responses, distribute to affected parties. Auto-numbering.
Submittal log management with review workflow. Track shop drawings, product data, and samples through approval chain.
Current set management ensuring field crews work from latest drawings. Automatic distribution of updates with acknowledgment tracking.
Track permit applications, inspections, and approvals. Automatic reminders for expiring permits and required inspections.
Secure storage for contracts, insurance certificates, and compliance documents. Expiration tracking with automatic alerts.
Capture photos directly from mobile app with automatic GPS, timestamp, and project tagging. Batch upload with offline queuing.
Automatic categorization by content (electrical, framing, painting). Smart albums
Link before and after photos from same location. Slider comparison for client presentations.
Annotate photos with text, arrows, and highlights. Mark deficiencies for punch list items.
Automatic time-lapse videos from photos taken at fixed locations over project duration.
Digital daily logs capture work performed, conditions encountered, and resources used — all from mobile devices in the field.
Configurable templates by project type: general contractor, specialty trade, residential, commercial. Required fields ensure consistent documentation.
Automatic weather capture for each site. Links conditions to work performed for delay documentation.
Log who worked, what they accomplished, and any issues encountered. Photo documentation linked to activities.
Record deliveries with photos, quantities, and condition notes. Flag damaged materials for vendor claims.
Track inspectors, architects, clients, and other visitors. Automatic notifications when key visitors are on site.
Subs can submit their own daily reports through limited portal access. Reviews required before acceptance.
GPS-enabled clock-in/clock-out from mobile devices. Geofencing ensures workers are at job site. Offline capability with sync.
Supervisor review and approval of time entries. Bulk approval for efficiency. Flag unusual entries (overtime, short days).
Photo receipt capture, expense categorization, project/cost code assignment. Approval workflow with accounting integration.
Automatic mileage logging based on GPS. Manual entry with odometer verification. IRS-compliant reporting.
Track equipment utilization hours for internal costing and maintenance scheduling.
Digital checklists for rough-in, framing, electrical, plumbing, HVAC, and final inspections. Photo documentation at each checkpoint.
Log deficiencies with photos, responsible party, and due date. Track resolution through punch list workflow.
Score completed work against quality standards. Trend analysis shows improvement or
Schedule and track municipal and third-party inspections. Record results and required re-inspections.
Record as-built conditions, product serial numbers, and installation details for warranty claims.
Daily and weekly safety checklists: PPE verification, equipment inspection, hazard identification. Required before work begins.
Mobile-first incident reporting with photos, witness statements, and injury details. Automatic supervisor notification.
Encourage near-miss reporting to prevent future incidents. Analysis identifies hazard patterns.
Pre-built OSHA-compliant forms and procedures. Audit trail documentation for inspections.
Track safety training completion, certifications, and renewal dates. Automatic reminders for expiring certifications.
Library of safety topics with attendance tracking. Schedule automatic distribution based on project hazards.
Full payroll processing for construction companies with unique requirements: multiple pay rates, job costing allocation, and complex union rules.
Support for workers with different rates by job, trade, or certification level. Automatic rate selection based on work performed.
allocated to projects and cost codes based on time entries. Split entries across multiple jobs.
Configurable overtime rules: weekly, daily, California style. Automatic calculation with audit trail.
ACH direct deposit with support for multiple accounts per employee. Next-day and same-day options.
Automatic federal and state tax calculations. Quarterly and annual filing with supported states.
Track prevailing wage requirements by project and trade. Automatic rate lookup for covered projects.
Generate WH-347 and state-specific certified payroll reports.
Track fringe benefit requirements and payments. Support for benefit funds vs. cash payments.
Monitor apprentice-to-journeyman ratios for compliance. Alert when ratios fall outside requirements.
Generate union reports with dues calculations and benefit fund contributions.
Digital onboarding with e-signature for W-4, I-9, and company policies. Document collection and verification.
Track trade certifications, licenses, and skill levels. Automatic expiration alerts and renewal workflows.
Schedule and track performance reviews. Document feedback and development goals.
Track health insurance, 401(k), and other benefits enrollment. Integration with benefit providers.
For contractors who provide ongoing service, maintenance, or warranty work after initial project completion.
Create service tickets from client calls, portal requests, or technician observations. Capture issue details, photos, and urgency.
Assign tickets to technicians based on skills, location, and availability. Route optimization for multiple stops.
Technicians receive tickets on mobile app. Access client history, previous service records, and property details.
Track parts used on service calls. Manage truck inventory with automatic replenishment alerts.
Generate invoices from service tickets. Support for T&M, flat rate, and warranty billing types.
Register manufacturer and workmanship warranties at project completion. Track coverage terms and expiration.
File and track warranty claims with manufacturers. Document issues with photos and resolution.
Automatic client notifications for warranty expiration. Offer extended warranty or service plans.
Track warranty costs by project, trade, and issue type. Identify recurring problems for quality improvement.
Create recurring service agreements with scheduled visits. HVAC tune-ups, roof inspections, etc.
Automatic invoicing for service agreements. Support for monthly, quarterly, and annual billing.
Auto-schedule maintenance visits based on agreement terms. Client notification and confirmation.
Track agreement expiration with automatic renewal offers. Analyze retention rates.
Comprehensive reporting with construction-specific KPIs, custom dashboards, and automated report distribution.
P&L by project, client, or time period. Job cost reports, WIP reports, cash flow forecasts, and aging analysis.
Project status summary, milestone tracking, resource utilization, and variance analysis.
Lead conversion funnel, sales pipeline, win/loss analysis, and salesperson performance.
Daily log summaries, time entry analysis, safety incident trends, and quality scores.
Labor cost analysis, overtime reports, certified payroll, and workforce utilization.
Ticket volume, response times, warranty costs, and technician performance.
Drag-and-drop dashboard builder with real-time widgets. Save and share dashboards by role.
Automatic report generation and email distribution on configurable schedules.
Export to Excel, PDF, or CSV. API access for business intelligence tool integration.
The mobile experience is designed from the ground up for field use, not as a scaled-down desktop version.
Critical features work without connectivity. Queue changes locally and sync automatically when connection returns.
Large touch targets and gesture navigation designed for use with work gloves. Voice input for notes.
Camera integration for quick documentation. Batch uploads with automatic project tagging.
Common actions (clock in, add daily log, capture expense)
in under 3 taps from app launch.
Real-time alerts for schedule changes, approvals needed, and client messages. Configurable by notification type.
Support for Android and iOS. Optional MDM integration for company-owned devices.
Pre-built integrations with essential contractor tools, powered by Wasp's background job system for reliable sync.
Bidirectional sync of customers, invoices, payments, and expenses. Job cost class mapping.
Full accounting integration for international contractors. Multi-currency support.
Payment processing for client invoices. Stripe Connect for marketplace payouts.
Calendar sync for scheduling, Gmail integration for communication logging, Drive integration for document storage.
Outlook calendar sync, email logging, OneDrive document integration.
Home Depot Pro, ABC Supply, and Ferguson API connections for real-time pricing.
Lead import from home service marketplaces.
Automatic weather data for job sites. Forecast-based scheduling alerts.
Full REST API for third-party integrations. OAuth 2.0 authentication.
Configurable webhooks for project events, payment events, and status changes.
3.0 spec with interactive documentation. Code samples in Python, JavaScript, and Ruby.
Tiered rate limits by subscription plan. Burst allowance with smooth rate limiting.
Connect with 5,000+ apps through Zapier. No-code automation for common workflows.
Core platform infrastructure built on Wasp/Open SaaS with essential contractor workflows.
Initialize project with Open SaaS template. Configure multi-tenant architecture, Stripe billing, and Wasp auth.
Dashboard, project lifecycle, and basic reporting.
Multi-tenant user management with role-based access.
React Native or PWA foundation for field access.
Initial accounting sync via Wasp background jobs.
Full client-facing portal with project visibility, payments, and communication.
Digital takeoff, cost database, and proposal generation.
Lead capture, pipeline management, and automation.
Version control, RFI tracking, and photo management.
Gantt charts, resource allocation, and crew management.
Daily logs, time tracking, and mobile time clock.
Full job costing, accounting features, and advanced invoicing.
Inspection checklists, safety management, and compliance tracking.
Full payroll processing, certified payroll, and workforce management.
Service tickets, warranty tracking, and recurring agreements.
Custom dashboards, AI insights, and predictive analytics.
Public API, additional integrations, and Zapier connector.
Per-user monthly pricing with module-based add-ons. All tiers include core modules (Project Command Center, Analytics).
Up to 5 users. Core modules plus CRM, basic estimating, and client portal. Ideal for small remodelers and specialty contractors.
Up to 25 users. All modules except Payroll and Enterprise features. Full integrations. Ideal for growing contractors.
Unlimited users. All modules, Payroll, Service, API access, dedicated support, and custom development. Ideal for large GCs.
No framework licensing fees. Lower total cost of ownership compared to proprietary platforms.
Pay only for modules you use. Unlike competitors with all-or-nothing pricing.
No hidden fees for integrations, API access (Enterprise), or support.
14-day trial with full feature access. No credit card
70%+ of trial users complete onboarding and create first project within 3 days.
80%+ of licensed users log in at least weekly. 95%+ monthly login rate.
50%+ of users use mobile app. 70%+ use client portal. 60%+ use estimating module.
90%+ of projects have complete daily logs. 95%+ of invoices paid within 30 days.
99.9%+ uptime. <500ms average API response time. 99.5%+ transaction accuracy.
NPS score >50. Support ticket resolution <24 hours. <5% monthly churn.
Users report 15%+ reduction in administrative time. 10%+ improvement in project margin tracking accuracy.
Appendix A: Gap Resolution Summary (from v2.0)
This appendix documents the gaps identified in v1.0 and their resolution in v2.0/v3.0.
Added depreciation tracking in Section 6.2 (Scheduling & Resource Management).
New Module 10 added: Payroll & Workforce Management with certified payroll support.
New Module 11 added: Service & Warranty Management for post-construction support.
Added Section 4.4: Marketing Tools Suite with email campaigns and review management.
Added Section 7.2: Construction Accounting with WIP accounting support.
Added Hearth/GreenSky integration in Section 7.3 (Invoicing & Payment Processing).
Added Design Visualization feature in Section 8.1 (Client Portal).
Expanded Section 14 with payroll and service reports.
Added to Section 4.2 (Contact Management) for internal team compliance.
Corrected annual discounts in Section 18.2 to match tier pricing.
Appendix B: Wasp/Open SaaS Technical Reference
Key technical decisions and implementation notes for the development team.
v0.16.0+ required. Use latest stable release.
PostgreSQL 14+ with Prisma ORM. TimescaleDB extension for time-series data.
Primary: Fly.io via 'wasp deploy fly'. Staging: Railway. Self-hosted: Docker Compose.
Email (with verification), Google OAuth, GitHub OAuth configured in
-boss executor. QuickBooks sync every 4 hours. Daily stats nightly. Email digests at 6 AM.
AWS S3 with pre-signed uploads. CDN via CloudFront.
Stripe with Customer Portal. Lemon Squeezy as secondary option.
Plausible Analytics for usage. Sentry for error tracking. Custom admin dashboard for system health.
End of Document — Builders Stream Pro PRD v3.0 (Open SaaS / Wasp Edition)
Prepared February 2026 — Built on Open SaaS + Wasp Framework
